get.description:
IEEE 802.1X is an IEEE Standard for port-based Network Access Control (PNAC).
This standard provides an authentication mechanism to devices wishing to attach
to a LAN or WLAN.
IEEE 802.1X defines the encapsulation of the Extensible Authentication Protocol
(EAP) over IEEE 802, which is known as EAP over LAN (EAPOL).

802.1X authentication involves three entities, a supplicant, an authenticator,
and an authentication server.

*Supplicant*: An entity that wants to get authenticated.
*Authenticator*: A network device, such as an Ethernet switch that authenticates
the Supplicant.
*Authentication Server*: Typically a host running software supporting the RADIUS
and EAP protocols that provides an authentication service to an authenticator.

Until the Supplicant is authenticated, 802.1X Authenticator allows only EAPOL
traffic through the port to which the Supplicant is connected.
Only after the authentication is successful, the authenticator allows normal
traffic from the Supplicant.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaAaaDot1xauth_Dot1xauthSchema.description:
IEEE 802.1X is an IEEE Standard for port-based Network Access Control (PNAC).
This standard provides an authentication mechanism to devices wishing to attach
to a LAN or WLAN.
IEEE 802.1X defines the encapsulation of the Extensible Authentication Protocol
(EAP) over IEEE 802, which is known as EAP over LAN (EAPOL).

802.1X authentication involves three entities, a supplicant, an authenticator,
and an authentication server.

*Supplicant*: An entity that wants to get authenticated.
*Authenticator*: A network device, such as an Ethernet switch that authenticates
the Supplicant.
*Authentication Server*: Typically a host running software supporting the RADIUS
and EAP protocols that provides an authentication service to an authenticator.

Until the Supplicant is authenticated, 802.1X Authenticator allows only EAPOL
traffic through the port to which the Supplicant is connected.
Only after the authentication is successful, the authenticator allows normal
traffic from the Supplicant.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

denylist-on-failure.description: Add the station to denylist if machine authentication fails.

machine-default-role.description: Default role assigned on only completing Machine Authentication.

user-default-role.description: Configure the Role assigned on only completing User Authentication.

eap-type.description: EAP method, default method is EAP-PEAP.

enable.description: Enable 802.1X authentication to be terminated on the controller. This option is disabled by default

x-enumDescriptions.EAP_MSCHAPV2: EAP-MSCHAPV2 as the inner authentication protocol.
x-enumDescriptions.EAP_GTC: EAP-GenericTokenCard as the inner authentication protocol.

max-retries.description:
Number of authentication attempts before authentication fails.
GW supported max range is 5

eapol-max-requests.description:
The number of EAPOL requests to send to a supplicant
that must time out before authentication fails and
the authentication session ends.

max-reauth.description: Max number of reauthentication attempts before giving up.

eapol-timeout.description:
Time period (in seconds) to wait for a response from a client before
retransmitting an EAPoL PDU.

delete-keycache.description: Delete key cache entry when user entry is deleted.

opp-key-caching.description:
Enable Opportunistic Key Caching (WPA2/WPA3 Only).By default, the 802.1X authentication profile enables a
cached pairwise master key (PMK) derived via a client and
an associated AP and used when the client roams to a new AP.
This allows clients faster roaming without a full 802.1x authentication.

wpa-key-period.description: Set the time period between each WPA/WPA2/WPA3 key exchange.

wpa-key-retries.description: Set the Number of times WPA/WPA2/WPA3 Key Messages are retried.

quiet-period.description:
Time period (in seconds) to wait before processing an authentication
request from a client that failed authentication.

reauth-period.description:
Time period (in seconds) to enforce periodic re-authentication of
clients. This is applicable only when reauth is enabled

cached-reauth-period.description:
Time period (in seconds) during which cached re-authentication
is allowed. This is applicable only when cached-reauth is enabled.

discovery-period.description:
Time period (in seconds) to wait before an EAPoL request
identity frame re-transmission on an 802.1X enabled interface
with no authenticated client.

initial-auth-response-timeout.description:
Time period (in seconds) to wait for the first EAPoL frame from a
client before deeming the client to be incapable of 802.1X and
start authentication using the next configured authentication
method, if any.
If not set, the next configured authentication method is attempted only
after the authentication cycle of the current method is complete.

canned-eap-success-enable.description:
Allow the device to send a canned EAP success packet to the supplicant
to indicate a successful authentication when:
1. The authentication fails due to a RADIUS server reject, but
the interface on which the client on-boarded has a reject-role
configured.
2. The authentication fails due to a RADIUS server timeout, but
the interface on which the client on-boarded has a critical-role
configured.

macsec.description:
Enables the switch to provision a MACsec channel
dynamically when the 802.1X client is authenticated using
an EAP method that supports mutual authentication.

mka-cak-length.x-typeDescription: Secure Connectivity Association Key (CAK) length type.
mka-cak-length.description: Length of CAK to generate for MKA.

auth-vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
auth-vlan-id.description:
Configures the VLAN where the port is moved after a successful
authentication.

unauth-vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
unauth-vlan-id.description:
Configures the VLAN where the port is moved with an unauthenticated
client.

unauth-period.description:
Time period (in seconds) to wait before moving the interface to the
VLAN for unauthenticated clients.

x-enumDescriptions.AUTO:
The device connected to the port must support 802.1X authentication
and provide valid credentials to get network access.
x-enumDescriptions.AUTHORIZED:
Gives access to a device connected to the port even without a valid
802.1X crendential.
x-enumDescriptions.UNAUTHORIZED:
Deny access to a device connected to the port even with a valid
802.1X crendential.

server-timeout.description:
Time period (in seconds) to wait for a server response to an
authentication request. If there is no response within the configured
time frame, the device assumes that the authentication attempt has
timed out.

logoff-period.description:
Time period (in seconds) after which a client will be considered
removed from the port for a lack of activity.

client-limit.description: Maximum number of clients that can be authenticated on the interface.

ca-cert.description: CA Certificate Name for the Client Certificate Verification.

cert-cn-lookup.description: Check certificate common name against AAA server.

enforce-suite-b-128.description: Enable Suite-B 128 bit or more security level Authentication enforcement.

enforce-suite-b-192.description: Enable Suite-B 192 bit or more security level Authentication enforcement.

heldstate-bypass.description: Maximum number of times station can send bad credentials

tls-guest-access.description: Enable guest access for users with valid certificate.

multicast-keyrotation.description: Enable or Disable Multicast Key Rotation.

reauth-server-termination-action.description: Use the termination-action attribute from the Server.

keycache-timeout.description: Per BSSID PMKSA (Pairwise Master Key Security Association) cache interval in hours.

multicast-key-rotation-period.description: Set the period between multicast key rotation.

unicast-key-rotation-period.description: Set the period between unicast key rotation.

wpa-groupkey-delay.description: Delay between WPA unicast and multicast key exchange.

wpa2-key-delay.description: Delay between EAP-Success and unicast key exchange.

unicast-keyrotation.description: Enable or Disable Unicast Key Rotation.

use-session-key.description: Use RADIUS Session Key as the unicast WEP key. This option is disabled by default.

use-static-key.description: Use Static Key as the Unicast/Multicast WEP key.This option is disabled by default.

validate-pmkid.description:
PMK (Pairwise Master Key) identifier (WPA2/WPA3 Only).
This parameter instructs the controller to check the pairwise master key (PMK) ID
sent by the client. When this option is enabled,
the client must send a PMKID in the associate or reassociate frame to indicate that it supports OKC or PMK caching;
otherwise, full 802.1x authentication takes place.

wep-key-retries.description: Set the Number of times Unicast/Multicast EAPOL Key Messages are sent to the station.

wep-key-size.description: Set the Dynamic WEP Key Size.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
